trans-unit.source: Set File Service Properties
trans-unit.target: Set File Service Properties

trans-unit.source: The <legacyBold>Set File Service Properties</legacyBold> operation sets properties for a storage account’s File service endpoint, which supports setting CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) rules.
trans-unit.target: The <legacyBold>Set File Service Properties</legacyBold> operation sets properties for a storage account’s File service endpoint, which supports setting CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) rules.

trans-unit.source: Supported in Version 2015-02-21 and later.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Version 2015-02-21 and later.

trans-unit.source: For detailed information about CORS rules and evaluation logic, see <externalLink><linkText>Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) Support for the Azure Storage Services</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dn535601.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For detailed information about CORS rules and evaluation logic, see <externalLink><linkText>Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) Support for the Azure Storage Services</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dn535601.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: The <legacyBold>Set File Service Properties</legacyBold> request may be specified as follows.
trans-unit.target: The <legacyBold>Set File Service Properties</legacyBold> request may be specified as follows.

trans-unit.source: HTTPS is recommended.
trans-unit.target: HTTPS is recommended.

trans-unit.source: Replace <account-name> with the name of your storage account:
trans-unit.target: Replace <account-name> with the name of your storage account:

trans-unit.target: Method

trans-unit.target: Request URI

trans-unit.source: HTTP Version
trans-unit.target: HTTP Version

trans-unit.source: PUT
trans-unit.target: PUT

trans-unit.source: HTTP/1.1
trans-unit.target: HTTP/1.1

trans-unit.source: Note that the URI must always include the forward slash (/) to separate the host name from the path and query portions of the URI.
trans-unit.target: Note that the URI must always include the forward slash (/) to separate the host name from the path and query portions of the URI.

trans-unit.source: In the case of this operation, the path portion of the URI is empty.
trans-unit.target: In the case of this operation, the path portion of the URI is empty.

trans-unit.target: URI PARAMETERS

trans-unit.target: URI Parameter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: The combination of both query strings is required to set the storage service properties.
trans-unit.target: The combination of both query strings is required to set the storage service properties.

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: The <parameterReference>timeout</parameterReference> parameter is expressed in seconds.
trans-unit.target: The <parameterReference>timeout</parameterReference> parameter is expressed in seconds.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Setting Timeouts for File Service Operations</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dn689089.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Setting Timeouts for File Service Operations</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dn689089.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.target: REQUEST HEADERS

trans-unit.source: The following table describes required and optional request headers.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes required and optional request headers.

trans-unit.source: Request Header
trans-unit.target: Request Header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the authentication scheme, storage account name, and signature.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the authentication scheme, storage account name, and signature.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Authentication for the Azure Storage Services</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dd179428.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Authentication for the Azure Storage Services</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dd179428.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) for the request.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) for the request.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Authentication for the Azure Storage Services</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dd179428.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Authentication for the Azure Storage Services</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dd179428.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Required for all authenticated requests.
trans-unit.target: Required for all authenticated requests.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Versioning for the Azure Storage Services</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dd894041.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Versioning for the Azure Storage Services</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dd894041.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Provides a client-generated, opaque value with a 1 KB character limit that is recorded in the analytics logs when storage analytics logging is enabled.
trans-unit.target: Provides a client-generated, opaque value with a 1 KB character limit that is recorded in the analytics logs when storage analytics logging is enabled.

trans-unit.source: Using this header is highly recommended for correlating client-side activities with requests received by the server.
trans-unit.target: Using this header is highly recommended for correlating client-side activities with requests received by the server.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>About Storage Analytics Logging</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/hh343262.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> and <externalLink><linkText>Azure Logging: Using Logs to Track Storage Requests</linkText><linkUri>http://blogs.msdn.com/b/windowsazurestorage/archive/2011/08/03/windows-azure-storage-logging-using-logs-to-track-storage-requests.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>About Storage Analytics Logging</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/hh343262.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> and <externalLink><linkText>Azure Logging: Using Logs to Track Storage Requests</linkText><linkUri>http://blogs.msdn.com/b/windowsazurestorage/archive/2011/08/03/windows-azure-storage-logging-using-logs-to-track-storage-requests.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: REQUEST BODY
trans-unit.target: REQUEST BODY

trans-unit.source: The format of the request body is as follows:
trans-unit.target: The format of the request body is as follows:

trans-unit.source: You can call <legacyBold>Set File Service Properties</legacyBold> with one or more root elements specified in the request body.
trans-unit.target: You can call <legacyBold>Set File Service Properties</legacyBold> with one or more root elements specified in the request body.

trans-unit.source: The root elements include:
trans-unit.target: The root elements include:

trans-unit.source: It is not necessary to specify every root element on the request.
trans-unit.target: It is not necessary to specify every root element on the request.

trans-unit.source: If you omit a root element, the existing settings for the service for that functionality are preserved.
trans-unit.target: If you omit a root element, the existing settings for the service for that functionality are preserved.

trans-unit.source: However, if you do specify a given root element, you must specify every child element for that element.The following table describes the elements of the request body:
trans-unit.target: However, if you do specify a given root element, you must specify every child element for that element.The following table describes the elements of the request body:

trans-unit.source: Element Name
trans-unit.target: Element Name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Cors</languageKeyword> element is supported for version 2015-02-21 or later.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Cors</languageKeyword> element is supported for version 2015-02-21 or later.

trans-unit.source: Groups all CORS rules.Omitting this element group will not overwrite existing CORS settings.
trans-unit.target: Groups all CORS rules.Omitting this element group will not overwrite existing CORS settings.

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies a CORS rule for the File service.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a CORS rule for the File service.

trans-unit.source: You can include up to five <languageKeyword>CorsRule</languageKeyword> elements in the request.
trans-unit.target: You can include up to five <languageKeyword>CorsRule</languageKeyword> elements in the request.

trans-unit.source: If no <languageKeyword>CorsRule</languageKeyword> elements are included in the request body, all CORS rules will be deleted, and CORS will be disabled for the File service.
trans-unit.target: If no <languageKeyword>CorsRule</languageKeyword> elements are included in the request body, all CORS rules will be deleted, and CORS will be disabled for the File service.

trans-unit.source: Required if <languageKeyword>CorsRule</languageKeyword> element is present.
trans-unit.target: Required if <languageKeyword>CorsRule</languageKeyword> element is present.

trans-unit.source: A comma-separated list of origin domains that will be allowed via CORS, or "*" to allow all domains.
trans-unit.target: A comma-separated list of origin domains that will be allowed via CORS, or "*" to allow all domains.

trans-unit.source: Limited to 64 origin domains.
trans-unit.target: Limited to 64 origin domains.

trans-unit.source: Each allowed origin can have up to 256 characters.
trans-unit.target: Each allowed origin can have up to 256 characters.

trans-unit.source: Required if <languageKeyword>CorsRule</languageKeyword> element is present.
trans-unit.target: Required if <languageKeyword>CorsRule</languageKeyword> element is present.

trans-unit.source: A comma-separated list of response headers to expose to CORS clients.
trans-unit.target: A comma-separated list of response headers to expose to CORS clients.

trans-unit.source: Limited to 64 defined headers and two prefixed headers.
trans-unit.target: Limited to 64 defined headers and two prefixed headers.

trans-unit.source: Each header can be up to 256 characters.
trans-unit.target: Each header can be up to 256 characters.

trans-unit.source: Required if <languageKeyword>CorsRule</languageKeyword> element is present.
trans-unit.target: Required if <languageKeyword>CorsRule</languageKeyword> element is present.

trans-unit.source: The number of seconds that the client/browser should cache a preflight response.
trans-unit.target: The number of seconds that the client/browser should cache a preflight response.

trans-unit.source: Required if <languageKeyword>CorsRule</languageKeyword> element exists.
trans-unit.target: Required if <languageKeyword>CorsRule</languageKeyword> element exists.

trans-unit.source: A comma-separated list of headers allowed to be part of the cross-origin request.
trans-unit.target: A comma-separated list of headers allowed to be part of the cross-origin request.

trans-unit.source: Limited to 64 defined headers and 2 prefixed headers.
trans-unit.target: Limited to 64 defined headers and 2 prefixed headers.

trans-unit.source: Each header can be up to 256 characters.
trans-unit.target: Each header can be up to 256 characters.

trans-unit.source: Required if <languageKeyword>CorsRule</languageKeyword> element exists.
trans-unit.target: Required if <languageKeyword>CorsRule</languageKeyword> element exists.

trans-unit.source: A comma-separated list of HTTP methods that are allowed to be executed by the origin.
trans-unit.target: A comma-separated list of HTTP methods that are allowed to be executed by the origin.

trans-unit.source: For Azure Storage, permitted methods are DELETE, GET, HEAD, MERGE, POST, OPTIONS or PUT.
trans-unit.target: For Azure Storage, permitted methods are DELETE, GET, HEAD, MERGE, POST, OPTIONS or PUT.

trans-unit.source: Response
trans-unit.target: Response

trans-unit.source: The response includes an HTTP status code and a set of response headers.
trans-unit.target: The response includes an HTTP status code and a set of response headers.

trans-unit.source: STATUS CODE
trans-unit.target: STATUS CODE

trans-unit.source: A successful operation returns status code 202 (Accepted).
trans-unit.target: A successful operation returns status code 202 (Accepted).

trans-unit.source: RESPONSE HEADERS
trans-unit.target: RESPONSE HEADERS

trans-unit.source: The response for this operation includes the following headers.
trans-unit.target: The response for this operation includes the following headers.

trans-unit.source: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.
trans-unit.target: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.

trans-unit.source: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Response Header
trans-unit.target: Response Header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: A value that uniquely identifies a request made against the service.
trans-unit.target: A value that uniquely identifies a request made against the service.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the version of the operation used for the response.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the version of the operation used for the response.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Versioning for the Azure Storage Services</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dd894041.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Versioning for the Azure Storage Services</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dd894041.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: RESPONSE BODY
trans-unit.target: RESPONSE BODY

trans-unit.source: None.
trans-unit.target: None.

trans-unit.source: Authorization
trans-unit.target: Authorization

trans-unit.source: Only the account owner may call this operation.
trans-unit.target: Only the account owner may call this operation.

trans-unit.source: The following restrictions and limitations apply to CORS rules in Azure Storage:
trans-unit.target: The following restrictions and limitations apply to CORS rules in Azure Storage:

trans-unit.source: A maximum of five rules can be stored.
trans-unit.target: A maximum of five rules can be stored.

trans-unit.source: The maximum size of all CORS rules settings on the request, excluding XML tags, should not exceed 2 KB.
trans-unit.target: The maximum size of all CORS rules settings on the request, excluding XML tags, should not exceed 2 KB.

trans-unit.source: The length of an allowed header, exposed header, or allowed origin should not exceed 256 characters.
trans-unit.target: The length of an allowed header, exposed header, or allowed origin should not exceed 256 characters.

trans-unit.source: Allowed headers and exposed headers may be either:
trans-unit.target: Allowed headers and exposed headers may be either:

trans-unit.source: Literal headers, where the exact header name is provided, such as x-ms-meta-processed.
trans-unit.target: Literal headers, where the exact header name is provided, such as x-ms-meta-processed.

trans-unit.source: A maximum of 64 literal headers may be specified on the request.
trans-unit.target: A maximum of 64 literal headers may be specified on the request.

trans-unit.source: Prefixed headers, where a prefix of the header is provided, such as x-ms-meta-data*.
trans-unit.target: Prefixed headers, where a prefix of the header is provided, such as x-ms-meta-data*.

trans-unit.source: Specifying a prefix in this manner allows or exposes any header that begins with the given prefix.
trans-unit.target: Specifying a prefix in this manner allows or exposes any header that begins with the given prefix.

trans-unit.source: A maximum of two prefixed headers may be specified on the request.
trans-unit.target: A maximum of two prefixed headers may be specified on the request.

trans-unit.source: The methods (or HTTP verbs) specified in the <languageKeyword>AllowedMethods</languageKeyword> element must conform to the methods supported by Azure storage service APIs.
trans-unit.target: The methods (or HTTP verbs) specified in the <languageKeyword>AllowedMethods</languageKeyword> element must conform to the methods supported by Azure storage service APIs.

trans-unit.source: Supported methods are DELETE, GET, HEAD, MERGE, POST, OPTIONS and PUT.
trans-unit.target: Supported methods are DELETE, GET, HEAD, MERGE, POST, OPTIONS and PUT.

trans-unit.source: Specifying CORS rules on the request is optional.
trans-unit.target: Specifying CORS rules on the request is optional.

trans-unit.source: If you call <languageKeyword>Set File Service Properties</languageKeyword> without specifying the Cors element in the request body, any existing CORS rules are maintained.
trans-unit.target: If you call <languageKeyword>Set File Service Properties</languageKeyword> without specifying the Cors element in the request body, any existing CORS rules are maintained.

trans-unit.source: To disable CORS, call <languageKeyword>Set File Service Properties</languageKeyword> with an empty CORS rules settings (<legacyItalic>i.e.</legacyItalic>,</Cors>) and no inner CORS rules.
trans-unit.target: To disable CORS, call <languageKeyword>Set File Service Properties</languageKeyword> with an empty CORS rules settings (<legacyItalic>i.e.</legacyItalic>,</Cors>) and no inner CORS rules.

trans-unit.source: This call deletes any existing rules, disabling CORS for the File service.
trans-unit.target: This call deletes any existing rules, disabling CORS for the File service.

trans-unit.source: All CORS rule elements are required if the <languageKeyword>CorsRule</languageKeyword> element is specified.
trans-unit.target: All CORS rule elements are required if the <languageKeyword>CorsRule</languageKeyword> element is specified.

trans-unit.source: The request will fail with error code 400 (Bad Request) if any element is missing.
trans-unit.target: The request will fail with error code 400 (Bad Request) if any element is missing.

trans-unit.source: For detailed information about CORS rules and evaluation logic, see <externalLink><linkText>Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) Support for the Azure Storage Services</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dn535601.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For detailed information about CORS rules and evaluation logic, see <externalLink><linkText>Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) Support for the Azure Storage Services</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dn535601.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
